titleStmt.title: His Majesties gracious message to the army for peace. And His desires touching the treaty: with His royall promise to them, upon the re-inthroning of His Royal Person, and disbanding of their forces. And Lieut. Gen. Cromwels declaration, for an agreement with the King, and his propositions touching the treaty. Signed, O. Cromwell. Also, a petition of the citizens of London, to the House of Commons on Munday last, concerning his Majesty; and the armies proposals to the City of London, in relation to the King and the treaty.
titleStmt.author: Cromwell, Oliver, 1599-1658.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I). aut

notesStmt.note: Consists of a letter signed on p.2: O. Cromwell, description of Marquis of Argyle's surrender, and a portrayal of the positions of the army and the King regarding the personal treaty.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
